qas.question: What language is Carduchi thought to have become?
What language did Herodotus invent a name for?
What cannot be inferred from the impact on a neighboring language?
What kind of substrate is Middle Iranian?
Who reported vocabulary for old Persian?

context: In addition to Old Persian and Avestan, which are the only directly attested Old Iranian languages, all Middle Iranian languages must have had a predecessor "Old Iranian" form of that language, and thus can all be said to have had an (at least hypothetical) "Old" form. Such hypothetical Old Iranian languages include <b2_0>Carduchi<b2_0/> (the hypothetical predecessor to <a0_0>Kurdish<a0_0/>) and Old Parthian. Additionally, <b3_0>the existence of unattested languages<b3_0/> can sometimes be inferred from the impact they had on neighbouring languages. Such transfer is known to have occurred for Old Persian, which has (what is called) a "<b4_0>Median<b4_0/>" substrate in some of its vocabulary. Also, foreign references to languages can also provide a hint to the existence of otherwise unattested languages, for example through toponyms/ethnonyms or in the recording of vocabulary, as <b5_0>Herodotus<b5_0/> did for what he called "<a1_0>Scythian<a1_0/>".
